abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the National Highway
            Project for India is for road users to benefit from an
            improved journey between Lucknow and Muzaffarpur. The
            restructuring involved removing the activities covered by
            the four poorly performing works contracts (comprising 155
            km out of 483 km of roads originally financed) from the
            project description and include additional activities which
            are; introduction of a new safer-greener highways pilot (55
            Km); strengthening of the Road Safety Cell (RSC) and;
            implementation of a new Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
